clinical_notes.text: Robert J. Smith, 49 y.o. male, presents for annual exam. Reports mild fatigue but otherwise healthy. No chest pain or shortness of breath. BMI: 29. BP: 138/82. Non-smoker. No regular exercise. Assessment: overweight, borderline hypertension. Plan: counsel on weight loss and exercise; labs ordered.
Basic metabolic panel normal. Lipids: LDL 142 (elevated), HDL 45. Fasting glucose: 102 (borderline). Plan: dietary counseling.
Complaint: sinus congestion, cough. Diagnosed with viral URI. Recommended fluids, OTC decongestants. No antibiotics prescribed.
50 y.o. male. BP: 142/88. Weight: 198 lbs. Reports occasional constipation. Family history: Father had colon cancer at age 62. Counseled on colon cancer screening; referral placed for colonoscopy.
Instruction: Please schedule your colonoscopy as discussed with Dr. Adams. Call GI clinic at 555-222-8888 to arrange appointment.
Follow-up on cholesterol. LDL remains high at 150. Started atorvastatin 20 mg daily. Reports no muscle aches. Encouraged diet changes.
Complaint: mild back pain. No trauma. Exam benign. Treated conservatively with stretching exercises and ibuprofen PRN.
51 y.o. male. BP: 136/80. Weight: 194 lbs. Reports he never scheduled the colonoscopy despite prior referral. Advised again to complete screening.
Fasting glucose: 108. A1C: 5.7%. Lipids: LDL 132. Stable renal function. Continue atorvastatin.
Patient called for guidance on home stool FIT test. Explained test is acceptable but colonoscopy preferred given family history. Patient agreed to consider colonoscopy referral again.
53 y.o. male. Reports good adherence to statin, cholesterol improved. BP borderline. Discussed exercise and diet. Advised again colonoscopy is overdue, patient acknowledges but has not scheduled.
Complaint: left knee pain after jogging. Exam shows mild effusion, likely early osteoarthritis. Referred to physical therapy. Continue ibuprofen PRN.
54 y.o. male. BP: 138/84. BMI: 28. No acute complaints. Past reminders about colonoscopy documented. Patient states he will schedule this year. Labs ordered.
Fasting glucose: 111 (impaired fasting glucose). LDL 128. Continue statin. Counsel weight loss. Screening: colonoscopy not yet documented.

55 y.o. male. Doing well overall. BP 134/82. Cholesterol improved on statin. No chest pain or SOB. Colonoscopy still not documented despite multiple reminders. Strongly advised to schedule as soon as possible.
